_metadata.description: Sanctuary jurisdiction reference data for cross-referencing with incidents
_metadata.notes: State classifications based on state law; local classifications may differ. Policy conflicts noted where city/county policy differs from state mandate.
_metadata.verification_note: All entries include source_url linking to official legislative text or government source

California.notes: Statewide sanctuary law limiting local cooperation with ICE. Additional protections added 2025.

Colorado.notes: Prohibits honoring ICE detainers without judicial warrant.

Connecticut.notes: Limits compliance with ICE detainers to judicial warrants.

Illinois.notes: DOJ sued Pritzker Dec 2025 over new protection laws passed after Midway Blitz.

Maryland.source_name: Maryland General Assembly - Trust Act SB 167

Massachusetts.notes: State supreme court ruled detainers not legally binding 2017.
Massachusetts.source_name: Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court - Lunn v. Commonwealth

New Jersey.notes: Newark mayor defied ICE publicly Jan 2025.

New York.notes: NYC has strongest protections; state varies by county.
New York.source_name: NY Senate - Executive Law 837-p (Protect Our Courts Act)

Oregon.notes: Oldest sanctuary law in nation. Portland police prohibited from immigration enforcement.

Washington.source_name: Washington Legislature - HB 1497 Keep Washington Working Act

Minnesota.notes: No formal statewide law but Minneapolis/St. Paul and Hennepin County operate as strong sanctuary jurisdictions. Governor Walz under DOJ investigation Jan 2026. State declined to assist ICE enforcement, prompting massive federal response.
Minnesota.source_name: MN House Research - Immigration Enforcement Overview

Texas.notes: Bans sanctuary policies statewide. Criminal penalties for officials. Local jurisdictions like Austin constrained.

Florida.notes: All sheriffs signed ICE cooperation agreements. Only 3 detainers declined statewide 2025.

Arizona.notes: Historically aggressive enforcement. Some provisions struck down.

Georgia.notes: Site of Hyundai plant raid (475 detained).

Tennessee.notes: Criminal penalties for officials who adopt sanctuary policies; removal from office upon conviction.

Louisiana.notes: State troopers empowered with immigration enforcement authority.

North Carolina.notes: Varies significantly by county. Wake County cooperative; Mecklenburg declined detainers until 2025.
North Carolina.source_name: NC Sheriffs Association - Immigration Policy Overview

Virginia.notes: Northern Virginia localities more restrictive; rural areas cooperative.

Pennsylvania.notes: Philadelphia has sanctuary policy; rest of state varies.
Pennsylvania.source_name: City of Philadelphia - ICE Policy (state has no statewide policy)

Michigan.notes: Detroit and Ann Arbor have sanctuary policies.
Michigan.source_name: Michigan AG - Civil Rights (no statewide policy)

Wisconsin.notes: Madison and Milwaukee have sanctuary-like policies.

Nevada.notes: Las Vegas Metro PD has limited cooperation policy.

District of Columbia.notes: DC has strong sanctuary protections; does not honor ICE detainers.

Puerto Rico.notes: US territory with different legal framework. Generally cooperative with federal enforcement.
Puerto Rico.source_name: Puerto Rico Office of Legislative Services

Maine.notes: Limits state/local cooperation with ICE detainers.

Mississippi.notes: Anti-sanctuary state; law enforcement required to cooperate with ICE.

Missouri.notes: No statewide sanctuary or anti-sanctuary law. Varies by locality.
Missouri.source_name: Missouri Revisor of Statutes (no statewide policy)

Montana.notes: No statewide policy. Rural state with limited ICE presence.

Nebraska.notes: Bans sanctuary policies; requires cooperation with federal immigration enforcement.

South Carolina.notes: Requires law enforcement to verify immigration status; cooperate with ICE.
South Carolina.source_name: SC Code of Laws - Title 17 Chapter 13

Utah.notes: No formal statewide policy. Salt Lake City has some protective policies.

Arkansas.notes: Bans sanctuary policies in the state.

Hawaii.notes: Limits law enforcement cooperation with ICE.

Delaware.notes: Limits ICE cooperation to judicial warrants.

North Dakota.source_name: North Dakota Century Code (no statewide policy)

South Dakota.source_name: South Dakota Codified Laws (no statewide policy)

Austin, TX.notes: Historically immigrant-friendly but constrained by TX SB4. APD contacted ICE 33 times Jan-Sept 2025. Chief Davis: 'to me, means it's a sanctuary city' but cannot prohibit ICE contact.

Houston, TX.notes: Complies with SB4. Large immigrant population.

San Antonio, TX.notes: Former sanctuary policy now constrained by SB4.

Los Angeles, CA.notes: Special Order 40 (1979) - oldest major city sanctuary policy.

San Francisco, CA.source_name: SF Office of Labor Standards - Sanctuary City Ordinance

San Diego, CA.notes: DOJ designated. Border county with complex dynamics.
San Diego, CA.source_name: San Diego PD - Community Relations Policy

New York City, NY.notes: Executive Order 41 (2003, expanded). Strongest municipal protections.

Chicago, IL.notes: Welcoming City Ordinance. Site of numerous 2025 enforcement operations.
Chicago, IL.source_name: Chicago Municipal Code - Welcoming City Ordinance

Denver, CO.notes: Denver Public Schools filed (later dismissed) lawsuit over sensitive locations.

Portland, OR.notes: Police prohibited from immigration enforcement since 1987.
Portland, OR.source_name: Portland City Code 3.113 - Prohibition on Federal Immigration Enforcement

Minneapolis, MN.notes: One of the most aggressive sanctuary cities in the US. DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey over 1,360 declined detainers. Site of massive federal response including Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ officers. Hennepin County also declines detainers.

Newark, NJ.notes: Mayor Ras Baraka publicly defied ICE Jan 2025.
Newark, NJ.source_name: Newark Mayor Executive Order on Sanctuary Status

Philadelphia, PA.notes: City policy in neutral state. Executive Order 2016.
Philadelphia, PA.source_name: City of Philadelphia - Policy Limiting ICE Cooperation

Boston, MA.source_name: City of Boston - TRUST Act Policy

Miami, FL.notes: Ended sanctuary policy 2017 after state law.

Las Vegas, NV.notes: Metro PD has limited cooperation; does not honor all detainers.
Las Vegas, NV.source_name: Las Vegas Metro PD Policy Manual

Atlanta, GA.notes: City attempted sanctuary-like policies; constrained by state law.

Charlotte, NC.source_name: State-level: NC Sheriffs Association - Immigration Policy Overview

Raleigh, NC.source_name: State-level: NC Sheriffs Association - Immigration Policy Overview

Columbus, OH.source_name: State-level: Ohio Revised Code (no statewide policy)

Durango, CO.notes: Site of ICE field office protest with rubber bullets, pepper spray Oct 2025.

Berkeley, CA.notes: DOJ designated. One of oldest sanctuary cities (1971).
Berkeley, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

East Lansing, MI.source_name: State-level: Michigan AG - Civil Rights (no statewide policy)

Hoboken, NJ.notes: DOJ designated. Part of NJ AG Directive limiting ICE cooperation.
Hoboken, NJ.source_name: State-level: NJ Attorney General Directive 2018-6 v2.0

Jersey City, NJ.notes: DOJ designated. Part of NJ AG Directive limiting ICE cooperation.
Jersey City, NJ.source_name: State-level: NJ Attorney General Directive 2018-6 v2.0

Paterson, NJ.source_name: State-level: NJ Attorney General Directive 2018-6 v2.0

Rochester, NY.source_name: State-level: NY Senate - Executive Law 837-p (Protect Our Courts Act)

New Orleans, LA.notes: DOJ designated but Louisiana is anti-sanctuary state. City has historically limited cooperation but constrained by state law.

Broadview, IL.notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.
Broadview, IL.source_name: State-level: Illinois General Assembly - TRUST Act (SB 31)

Franklin Park, IL.notes: Chicago suburb under Illinois TRUST Act.
Franklin Park, IL.source_name: State-level: Illinois General Assembly - TRUST Act (SB 31)

Elgin, IL.notes: Chicago suburb under Illinois TRUST Act.
Elgin, IL.source_name: State-level: Illinois General Assembly - TRUST Act (SB 31)

Fort Bliss, TX.notes: Military base used for migrant detention. Federal jurisdiction on base.

El Paso, TX.notes: Border city. Constrained by SB4 despite historically immigrant-friendly local attitudes.

Alvarado, TX.notes: Site of multiple ICE enforcement operations.

McAllen, TX.notes: Border city, Rio Grande Valley. Major detention processing area.

Laredo, TX.notes: Border city with heavy CBP/ICE presence.

Camarillo, CA.notes: Ventura County. Site of ICE detention facility deaths.
Camarillo, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Paramount, CA.notes: LA County suburb under California Values Act.
Paramount, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Van Nuys, CA.notes: LA neighborhood. Under California Values Act and LAPD Special Order 40.
Van Nuys, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Northridge, CA.notes: LA neighborhood. Under California Values Act.
Northridge, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Santa Ana, CA.notes: Orange County. Large immigrant population, under California Values Act.
Santa Ana, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

San Bernardino, CA.notes: Inland Empire. Under California Values Act.
San Bernardino, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Ontario, CA.notes: Inland Empire, San Bernardino County. Under California Values Act.
Ontario, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Oakland, CA.notes: Strong sanctuary policy predating state law. Mayor warned residents of ICE raids 2018.
Oakland, CA.source_name: City of Oakland - Sanctuary City Policy

Montclair, CA.notes: San Bernardino County. Under California Values Act.
Montclair, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

San Jose, CA.notes: Under California Values Act. Santa Clara County is sanctuary.
San Jose, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Sacramento, CA.notes: State capital. Under California Values Act.
Sacramento, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Fresno, CA.notes: Central Valley. Under California Values Act but more conservative area.
Fresno, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Long Beach, CA.notes: LA County. Under California Values Act.
Long Beach, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Anaheim, CA.notes: Orange County. Under California Values Act.
Anaheim, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Aurora, CO.notes: Denver suburb. Under Colorado HB19-1124. Site of Aurora ICE detention facility.

Manhattan, NY.notes: Part of NYC. Under NYC Executive Order 41.
Manhattan, NY.source_name: State-level: NY Senate - Executive Law 837-p (Protect Our Courts Act)

Brooklyn, NY.notes: Part of NYC. Under NYC Executive Order 41.
Brooklyn, NY.source_name: State-level: NY Senate - Executive Law 837-p (Protect Our Courts Act)

Bronx, NY.notes: Part of NYC. Under NYC Executive Order 41.
Bronx, NY.source_name: State-level: NY Senate - Executive Law 837-p (Protect Our Courts Act)

Queens, NY.notes: Part of NYC. Under NYC Executive Order 41.
Queens, NY.source_name: State-level: NY Senate - Executive Law 837-p (Protect Our Courts Act)

Staten Island, NY.notes: Part of NYC. Under NYC Executive Order 41.
Staten Island, NY.source_name: State-level: NY Senate - Executive Law 837-p (Protect Our Courts Act)

Ellabell, GA.notes: Site of Hyundai Metaplant raid (475 detained). Bryan County.

Lovejoy, GA.notes: Location of Robert A. Deyton Detention Center (Clayton County).

Tacoma, WA.notes: Site of Northwest Detention Center (now Northwest ICE Processing Center). State has Keep Washington Working Act.
Tacoma, WA.source_name: State-level: Washington Legislature - HB 1497 Keep Washington Working Act

SeaTac, WA.notes: Airport area. Under Washington Keep Washington Working Act.
SeaTac, WA.source_name: State-level: Washington Legislature - HB 1497 Keep Washington Working Act

Omaha, NE.notes: Site of Glenn Valley Foods raid (75 detained). Nebraska is anti-sanctuary state (LB 1140).

Nashville, TN.notes: Davidson County had limited cooperation policy but constrained by TN SB6002 (2025) criminalizing sanctuary policies.

Des Moines, IA.notes: Iowa SF 481 requires cooperation. Polk County has 287(g) agreement.

Oklahoma City, OK.notes: Oklahoma HB 4156 grants state police immigration authority. Oklahoma County cooperative.

Tallahassee, FL.notes: State capital. Site of FSU campus enforcement (100 detained). Florida requires full ICE cooperation.

Jacksonville, FL.notes: Duval County. Florida requires full ICE cooperation.

Tampa, FL.notes: Hillsborough County. Florida requires full ICE cooperation.

Orlando, FL.notes: Orange County. Florida requires full ICE cooperation.

Norfolk, VA.notes: Virginia has no statewide policy. Norfolk generally cooperative.
Norfolk, VA.source_name: State-level: Code of Virginia - Criminal Procedure

Fitchburg, MA.notes: Under Massachusetts SJC ruling that detainers are not legally binding.
Fitchburg, MA.source_name: State-level: Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court - Lunn v. Commonwealth

Medford, MA.notes: Under Massachusetts SJC ruling. Boston metro area.
Medford, MA.source_name: State-level: Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court - Lunn v. Commonwealth

Washington DC, DC.notes: DC Sanctuary Values Act (2019). Does not honor ICE detainers.
Washington DC, DC.source_name: State-level: DC Code - Sanctuary Values Act

Liberty, MO.notes: Kansas City suburb. Missouri has no statewide policy.
Liberty, MO.source_name: State-level: Missouri Revisor of Statutes (no statewide policy)

Kansas City, MO.notes: Jackson County. Some limits on ICE cooperation. Missouri has no statewide policy.
Kansas City, MO.source_name: State-level: Missouri Revisor of Statutes (no statewide policy)

St. Louis, MO.notes: Independent city. Some limits on ICE cooperation.
St. Louis, MO.source_name: State-level: Missouri Revisor of Statutes (no statewide policy)

Glen Burnie, MD.notes: Anne Arundel County. Under Maryland TRUST Act.
Glen Burnie, MD.source_name: State-level: Maryland General Assembly - Trust Act SB 167

Laurel, MD.notes: Prince George's County. Under Maryland TRUST Act.
Laurel, MD.source_name: State-level: Maryland General Assembly - Trust Act SB 167

Salisbury, NC.notes: Rowan County. North Carolina varies by county; Rowan is cooperative.
Salisbury, NC.source_name: State-level: NC Sheriffs Association - Immigration Policy Overview

Coventry, VT.notes: Under Vermont Act 69. Rural area near Canadian border.

Burlington, VT.notes: Under Vermont Act 69 plus stronger local policy.

Jackson, MS.notes: State capital. Mississippi HB 1520 is anti-sanctuary.

Indianapolis, IN.notes: Marion County. Indiana IC 5-2-18.2 is anti-sanctuary.

Fort Worth, TX.notes: Tarrant County has 287(g) agreement. Texas SB4 mandates cooperation.

Pittsburgh, PA.notes: Allegheny County. Less protective than Philadelphia but some limits on ICE cooperation.
Pittsburgh, PA.source_name: State-level: City of Philadelphia - ICE Policy (state has no statewide policy)

Cincinnati, OH.notes: Hamilton County generally cooperative. Ohio has no statewide policy.
Cincinnati, OH.source_name: State-level: Ohio Revised Code (no statewide policy)

Cleveland, OH.notes: Cuyahoga County has some limits on ICE cooperation.
Cleveland, OH.source_name: State-level: Ohio Revised Code (no statewide policy)

Tucson, AZ.notes: City attempted sanctuary-like policies but constrained by Arizona SB 1070.

Mesa, AZ.notes: Maricopa County. 287(g) county. Arizona is anti-sanctuary.

Reno, NV.notes: Washoe County. Similar to Las Vegas Metro - limited cooperation.
Reno, NV.source_name: State-level: Nevada Revised Statutes (no statewide policy)

Salt Lake City, UT.notes: Some local limits on ICE cooperation despite no state policy.

Providence, RI.notes: Under Rhode Island executive order limiting ICE cooperation.

Hartford, CT.source_name: State-level: Connecticut General Assembly - TRUST Act

New Haven, CT.notes: First city to issue municipal ID cards to undocumented residents (2007). Strong local sanctuary.

Worcester, MA.notes: Under Massachusetts SJC ruling. Second largest city in MA.
Worcester, MA.source_name: State-level: Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court - Lunn v. Commonwealth

Charlottesville, VA.notes: University town. Some limits on ICE cooperation.
Charlottesville, VA.source_name: State-level: Code of Virginia - Criminal Procedure

Iowa City, IA.notes: University town that passed sanctuary resolution but constrained by Iowa SF 481.

North Las Vegas, NV.notes: Part of Las Vegas metro. Limited cooperation similar to Las Vegas Metro PD.
North Las Vegas, NV.source_name: State-level: Nevada Revised Statutes (no statewide policy)

Riviera Beach, FL.notes: Palm Beach County. Florida requires full ICE cooperation.

Memphis, TN.notes: Shelby County historically limited cooperation but constrained by TN SB6002 (2025).

Colorado Springs, CO.notes: El Paso County. More conservative than Denver but under state HB19-1124.

Springfield, IL.notes: State capital. Under Illinois TRUST Act.
Springfield, IL.source_name: State-level: Illinois General Assembly - TRUST Act (SB 31)

Bakersfield, CA.notes: Kern County. Under California Values Act but more conservative area.
Bakersfield, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Stockton, CA.notes: San Joaquin County. Under California Values Act.
Stockton, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Riverside, CA.notes: Inland Empire. Under California Values Act.
Riverside, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Modesto, CA.notes: Stanislaus County. Under California Values Act.
Modesto, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Ann Arbor, MI.notes: University town with strong sanctuary policy since 2003.
Ann Arbor, MI.source_name: State-level: Michigan AG - Civil Rights (no statewide policy)

Grand Rapids, MI.notes: Kent County. Some limits on ICE cooperation.
Grand Rapids, MI.source_name: State-level: Michigan AG - Civil Rights (no statewide policy)

Santa Fe, NM.notes: State capital. Under New Mexico HB 100.

Spokane, WA.notes: Under Washington Keep Washington Working Act. More conservative than Seattle.
Spokane, WA.source_name: State-level: Washington Legislature - HB 1497 Keep Washington Working Act

Louisville, KY.notes: Jefferson County. Kentucky has no statewide sanctuary policy; Louisville generally cooperative with ICE.
Louisville, KY.source_name: State-level: Kentucky Revised Statutes (no statewide policy)

Virginia Beach, VA.notes: Independent city. Virginia has no statewide policy; Virginia Beach generally cooperative.
Virginia Beach, VA.source_name: State-level: Code of Virginia - Criminal Procedure

Tulsa, OK.notes: Tulsa County. Oklahoma HB 4156 (2024) grants state police immigration enforcement authority.

Wichita, KS.notes: Sedgwick County. Kansas has no statewide sanctuary policy.

Honolulu, HI.notes: City and County of Honolulu. Hawaii HB 1975 (2022) limits law enforcement cooperation with ICE.

Corpus Christi, TX.notes: Nueces County. Under Texas SB4 (2017) mandating cooperation with ICE.

Lexington, KY.notes: Fayette County (merged city-county). Kentucky has no statewide policy.
Lexington, KY.source_name: State-level: Kentucky Revised Statutes (no statewide policy)

Henderson, NV.notes: Clark County. Similar to Las Vegas Metro - limited cooperation policy.
Henderson, NV.source_name: State-level: Nevada Revised Statutes (no statewide policy)

Saint Paul, MN.notes: Ramsey County. Mayor Kaohly Her (first Hmong mayor) criticized ICE door-to-door targeting. Part of Minneapolis-St. Paul coalition lawsuit against DHS.
Saint Paul, MN.source_name: State-level: MN House Research - Immigration Enforcement Overview

Greensboro, NC.notes: Guilford County. North Carolina varies by county; Guilford generally cooperative.
Greensboro, NC.source_name: State-level: NC Sheriffs Association - Immigration Policy Overview

Lincoln, NE.notes: Lancaster County. Nebraska LB 1140 (2024) bans sanctuary policies.

Anchorage, AK.notes: Municipality of Anchorage. Alaska has no statewide policy.

Irvine, CA.notes: Orange County. Under California Values Act (SB 54).
Irvine, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Durham, NC.notes: Durham County. More progressive than most NC counties; some limits on ICE cooperation.
Durham, NC.source_name: State-level: NC Sheriffs Association - Immigration Policy Overview

Chula Vista, CA.notes: San Diego County. Border city under California Values Act.
Chula Vista, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Toledo, OH.notes: Lucas County. Ohio has no statewide policy; Toledo generally cooperative.
Toledo, OH.source_name: State-level: Ohio Revised Code (no statewide policy)

Fort Wayne, IN.notes: Allen County. Indiana IC 5-2-18.2 is anti-sanctuary.

St. Petersburg, FL.notes: Pinellas County. Florida SB 168 (2019) requires full ICE cooperation.

Chandler, AZ.notes: Maricopa County. 287(g) county. Arizona is anti-sanctuary.

Scottsdale, AZ.notes: Maricopa County. 287(g) county. Arizona is anti-sanctuary.

Buffalo, NY.notes: Erie County. New York varies by county; Buffalo has some limits on ICE cooperation.
Buffalo, NY.source_name: State-level: NY Senate - Executive Law 837-p (Protect Our Courts Act)

Winston-Salem, NC.notes: Forsyth County. Generally cooperative with ICE.
Winston-Salem, NC.source_name: State-level: NC Sheriffs Association - Immigration Policy Overview

Chesapeake, VA.notes: Independent city. Virginia has no statewide policy.
Chesapeake, VA.source_name: State-level: Code of Virginia - Criminal Procedure

Fremont, CA.notes: Alameda County. Under California Values Act.
Fremont, CA.source_name: State-level: California Legislature - SB 54 Official Text

Hialeah, FL.notes: Miami-Dade County. Florida requires full ICE cooperation.

Richmond, VA.notes: Independent city (state capital). Some limits on ICE cooperation.
Richmond, VA.source_name: State-level: Code of Virginia - Criminal Procedure

Boise, ID.notes: Ada County. Idaho has no statewide policy.

Baton Rouge, LA.notes: East Baton Rouge Parish. Louisiana HB 101 (2024) grants state police immigration authority.

counties_287g_agreements._notes: Counties with active 287(g) agreements allowing local law enforcement to act as immigration agents
